Random Fighter Aircraft Generator

Description

Tool for randomly generating fighter aircraft models. The results are ideal for games that require many models with unique looks and silhouette.

High level usage

A single Plane can be instantiated from c# script using the Create method. This can be done Just in Time, however the mesh and texture generation may take 100ms so to use within a game it may be better to generate all instances on startup and use the results to instantiate copies using the Duplicate function when needed.

Classes

Plane

The Plane class is the main entry point for generating models. Use the Create function to generate a single instance. Plane extends MonoBehaviour so regular interfaces may be used e.g. it's rotation and position may be set.

Create

The Create function is used to generate a single instance of a Plane.

Declaration

public static Plane Create(PlaneInit init)

Example


        int seed = Random.Range(0, int.MaxValue);

        // generate a new plane
        var plane = LargeLaser.Plane.Create(new LargeLaser.PlaneInit()
            {
                Seed = seed
            });
    
        // initialise the new plane's transform
        plane.transform.position = new Vector(100,0,0);
        plane.transform.rotation = Quaternion.Euler(0,45,0);

Destroy

The Destroy utility function can be used to remove a single instance of a Plane.

Declaration

public void Destroy()

Example


        plane.Destroy();

Duplicate

The Duplicate utility function can be used to clone a Plane instance.

Declaration

public Plane Duplicate()

Example


        var planeCopy = plane.Duplicate();

        // initialise the new plane's transform
        planeCopy.transform.position = new Vector(100,0,0);
        planeCopy.transform.rotation = Quaternion.Euler(0,45,0);

SetFlapAngle

Sets the wing flaps to the specified angle in degrees. This function will do nothing if the Plane does not have wing flaps.

Declaration

public void SetFlapAngle(float angle)

Example


        plane.SetFlapAngle(45);

SetPropAngle

Sets the rotation angle of all propellers on this Plane instance. For propellers to spin this function will need to be called on an Update, ever increasing the angle. This function will do nothing if the Plane does not have propellers.

Declaration

public void SetPropAngle(float angle)

Example


        plane.SetPropAngle(45);

SetWingAngle

Sets the angle of sweeping wings. This function will do nothing if the Plane does not have sweeping wings.

Declaration

public void SetWingAngle(float angle)

Example


        plane.SetWingAngle(20);

WingTipLocators

List of GameObjects populated during the Plane creation. These are positioned at the wing extents and may be used to attach particles, trails or other effects.

Declaration

public List<GameObject> WingTipLocators

Example


        foreach(var wingTipLocator in plane.WingTipLocators)
        {
            // attach trail to wingTipLocator.transform
        }

EngineLocators

List of GameObjects populated during the Plane creation. These are positioned at the engine exhaust and may be used to attach particles, trails or other effects.

Declaration

public List<GameObject> EngineLocators

Example


        foreach(var engineLocator in plane.EngineLocators)
        {
            // attach trail to engineLocator.transform
        }

PlaneInit

The PlaneInit class is used to initialise a Plane instance. Pass an instance of a PlaneInit into the Plane Create function.

Arguments

BodyConfiguration BodyConfiguration Optionally override the body type of the generated plane.
Seed int The value with which to seed the random generation.
TextureSeed int Optional seed value with which to seed the texture generation. The textures must be created with TextureManager GenerateTextures

PlaneUtils

Class with utility functions.

Get

Returns a child Transform with the specified name.

Declaration

public static Transform Get(Transform parent, string name)

Example


        var child = LargeLaser.PlaneUtils.Get(transform, "ChildName");

InitWingSweep

Initialises a Plane instance with sweeping wings for Demo style updates. Note this will only be effective if the plane has sweeping wings. This function will not do anything if the plane has a wing configuration of anything other than sweep.

Declaration

public static void InitWingSweep(ref WingState wingState, ref float time, ref float direction)

Example


        WingState wingState;
        float wingTime;
        float wingDirection;
        LargeLaser.PlaneUtils.InitWingSweep(ref wingState, ref wingTime, ref wingDirection);

RotatePropeller

Updates propellers on a Plane instance. Note this will only be effective if the plane has propellers. This function will not do anything if the plane does not have propellers. Propeller angle may be directly set using the SetPropAngle function.

Declaration

public static void RotatePropeller(Plane plane, ref float angle)

Example


        float propAngle;
        LargeLaser.PlaneUtils.RotatePropeller(plane, ref propAngle);

UpdateFlaps

Updates wing flaps on a Plane instance for Demos. Note this will only be effective if the plane has wing flaps. This function will not do anything if the plane does not have wing flaps. Wing flap angle may be directly set using the SetFlapAngle function.

Declaration

public static void UpdateFlaps(Plane plane, ref float angle)

Example


        float flapAngle;
        LargeLaser.PlaneUtils.UpdateFlaps(currentPlane, ref flapAngle);

UpdateWingSweep

Updates swept wing angles on a Plane instance for Demos. Note this will only be effective if the plane has sweeping wings. This function will not do anything if the plane has a wing configuration of anything other than sweep. Sweeping wing angle may be directly set using the SetWingAngle function.

Declaration

public static void UpdateWingSweep(Plane plane, ref WingState wingState, ref float time, ref float direction)

Example


        WingState wingState;
        float wingTime;
        float wingDirection;
        LargeLaser.PlaneUtils.UpdateWingSweep(plane, ref wingState, ref wingTime, ref wingDirection);

Rand

The Rand class allows the random functionality to be overridden. It's usage is not required, and only needed if particular random functions are desired.

Create

Create a random instance using the currently defined method.

Declaration

public static IRand Create(int seed)

Example


        var random = LargeLaser.Rand.Create(System.DateTime.Now.Millisecond);

SetCreate

Defines the method for a random instance.

Declaration

public static void SetCreate(CreateInterface createRand)

Example


        LargeLaser.Rand.SetCreate((seed) =>
            {
                var res = new UnityRand();
                res.Init(seed);
                return res;
            });

TextureManager

The TextureManager class handles the textures applied to a Plane instance. It's usage is not required, and only needed if a particular texture set is desired to be applied.
To use a particular texture on a Plane, first call GenerateTextures with a specified seed, then also use this seed as the TextureSeed value of the PlaneInit instance when creating the Plane.

DestroyTextures

Remove allocated assets associated with this seed id.

Declaration

public static void DestroyTextures(int seed)

Example


        LargeLaser.TextureManager.DestroyTextures(textureSeed);

GenerateTextures

Create textures for a plane using the associated seed. This seed may be used as the TextureSeed value in a PlaneInit instance.

Declaration

public static void GenerateTextures(int seed)

Example


        int textureSeed = 100;
        LargeLaser.TextureManager.GenerateTextures(textureSeed);

Types

BodyConfiguration

enumeration

The BodyConfiguration field of PlaneInit may be optionally set to specify the body type, rather than it be randomly assigned. BodyConfiguration values:

Standard Single body with regular properties.
Boom Tail plane is suspended between two wing mounted booms.
Centre Body is held between two large engine housings.
FlyingWing Small body is encompased in a single wing.
ArrowHead Flattened with minimal cross section.

WingState

enumeration

WingState values:

Sweep Wings are actively animating.
Delay Wings are paused between aninations.

CreateInterface

Input callback type for the Rand SetCreate function.

Declaration

System.Func<int, IRand>

Assets

LargeLaserFighterBodyShader

The default shader used for the body of Plane instances. This may be overriden if necessary.

LargeLaserFighterGameObject

Base object used as the root of Plane instances.

Samples

Sample01

Open the LargeLaserFighterSample01 scene and run. This demonstrates basic plane generation each time the Space key is pressed.

Sample02

Open the LargeLaserFighterSample02 scene and run. This is a non-interactive demonstration showing positioning and creation of planes.

Sample03

Open the LargeLaserFighterSample03 scene and run. This demonstrates duplicating and sharing of textures, for example if all Planes are owned by a game faction.

Sample04

Open the LargeLaserFighterSample04 scene and run. This demonstrates overriding the random generator used internally when creating planes.
